fields.description:
In earlier versions of JIRA, the parent of an issue was displayed as a separate column (with image) when exporting a view to Excel.  In the fix for JRA-7014, the view was changed so that the parent issue key is now prepended to the issue summary.

A customer who wants to organize their Excel data using the parent issue key has to use substring functions and other methods to get the data they need.

It would be more useful if the parent issue were available as a separate column (with no icon).
fields.summary: Display parent column (without image) in Excel export

fields.description: When using the submit feature request option from the JIRA admin counsel, it would be nice if we could make appending the system information optional. I do not like that when I get emails from the support system, I have to scroll down just to get to my message.
fields.summary: Make system information optional

fields.description:
Currently we can only schedule services to run at one regular interval (Every 1 hour etc.)
I have a jelly script that I run to check for overdue items and send e-mail reminders to the assigned users.
I only want this to run every weekeday so we don't get unwanted e-mails at weekends.
Previously in JIRA 4.0 this was done with a Cron triggered Perl script that ran a Jelly script on JIRA.
In JIRA 4.1 the security was enhanced and included Form Tokens.
However this prevented my external Jelly script from running so I have had to disabled Form Token checking to allow my Jelly script to run. Obviously this is not ideal as I have compromised the security of my server slightly.
I raised a support request to see if it was possible to disable form token checking on just my script, but as expected this isn't possible either as this compromises the security as well as it gives the Jelly script access to all the classes in JIRA.
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-59186

So my idea would be to improve the Services scheduling so instead of one regular interval it could be configured to run at a certain time of day on certain days of the week, maybe by selection of check boxes.
This would allow Form Token checking to be enabled and mean configuring an automated Jelly script or any other services was much easier and more flexible.
fields.summary: Improved Scheduling System for Services

fields.description:
In a clean JIRA deployed in Websphere 6.1.0. according to our installation instruction the gadgeds won't be displayed correctly.

!dashboard.png|thumbnail!

The problem is caused by a missing definition of a servlet mapping for REST in {{web.xml}}.

A possible workaround this problem is to manually add the following servlet mapping within the section consisting other servlet mappings in {{web.xml}}: 
{code:xml}
<!-- This is a dummy servlet mapping to trick WebSphere 6.1.0.x to push the request through the filter chain,
         so that the REST servlet filter plugin can be properly mapped to and intercept the rest URLs
    -->
    <servlet-mapping>
        <servlet-name>noopservlet</servlet-name>
        <url-pattern>/rest/*</url-pattern>
    </servlet-mapping>
{code}
fields.summary: Gadgets in dashboard don't display correctly for Websphere deployments

fields.description:
*Symptom*
Follow the below steps:
1. add a charting gadget in a dashboard, e.g. Pie Chart Gadget
2. configure the gadget and save
3. click 'maximize' on this gadget
4. refresh current page, e.g. click 'F5'
5. click 'restore' on Dashboard
6. click 'maximize' and 'restore' again
The error dashboard page is shown: all gadgets on dashboard are duplicated 

*Workaround*
The correct dashboard can be restored when refreshing dashboard at a normal status (without maximized), or leaving to another page and back dashboard again
fields.summary: Gadgets are duplicated on Dashboard when selecting 'maximize' and 'restore' multiple times

This is a place holder issue to track us sending the translation files to the translators.

Notes:

The i18n-jira.r117702.10-06-2010_14-32.zip contains the main JIRA translations

The i18n-bundled-plugins.r117652.10-06-2010_10-39.zip contains the set of translations for the bundled plugins of JIRA. (It only contains data for the fisheye plugin because it is the only bundled plugin that has added new keys that need to be translated.)

Translators: Please make sure the directory structure of these zip files are maintained so we can know who to put the translated files back into the right places.

The *bundled-plugins* zip files only contain translations for plugins that have changed between JIRA 4.1 and JIRA 4.2.  This is why the  bundled plugins zip file only contains translations for the Fisheye plugin.

*4.1.2 Translations*

- [^i18n-bundled-plugins.r117341.15-06-2010_18-11.4_1_2.zip]
- [^i18n-jira.r117341.15-06-2010_18-11.4_1_2.zip]
fields.summary: JIRA 4.2 Translations

When the wiki renderer is enabled for a field and certain UTF-8 quotes are entered, Firefox renders them as a black square. When clicking the Preview icon they show correctly, and they're entered correctly into the database upon saving, it's just in the text field they're rendered incorrectly. See attached screenshot.

The Unicode characters that don't render correctly are as follows:

||Character||Name||Unicode||
|"|LEFT DOUBLE QUOTATION MARK|201C|
|"|RIGHT DOUBLE QUOTATION MARK|201D|
|‚|SINGLE LOW-9 QUOTATION MARK|201A|
|„|DOUBLE LOW-9 QUOTATION MARK|201E|
fields.summary: Firefox renders some UTF-8 quotes as black squares when the wiki renderer enabled

fields.description:
Here are the steps to reproduce this bug:
# Configure trusted apps in Confluence by adding JIRA Base URL 
# Grab the Confluence Activity Stream Gadget URL and copy it
# In your JIRA, click on Add Gadget
# Click 'Add Gadget to Directory'
# Paste in the Confluence Activity Stream Gadget URL
# Once the Confluence Activity Stream Gadget has been successfully added, in *All* tab, remove the most top Activity Stream (which is supposed to be JIRA Activity Stream)
# Then, click on *Confluence* tab
# Upon clicking on the 'Remove' button, I hit into this error message:
{noformat}
Sorry, we were not able to add that Gadget to the directory
{noformat}
- You will see the background of the Confluence Activity Stream becomes red in colour (see attached screenshot)

Removing the JIRA Activity Stream gadget (the above one) will actually removed the Confluence Activity Stream gadget but it did not get updated correctly. Doing a check in JIRA DB, there were empty set in {{externalgadget}} table as well. 

After a re-index, the Confluence tab in Gadget directory will be gone and you will no longer see the red colour background.
fields.summary: Unable to remove Confluence Activity Stream gadget from JIRA

fields.description:
1. Select Bulk Change.
2. Select few bugs to be changed, click Next.
3. Select Edit Issue, click Next.
4. Write a comment in "Change Comment" field.
5. Move to "Change Additional Recipients" custom field (or any field that has Selection of Users); note that "Change Comment" check box is automatically selected once you move focus to another field.
6. In "Change Additional Recipients", start typing some user name
7. Once a matching line with user name available, use arrow down and select the user.
8. Go to another field or click Next at the bottom.

Issue: Check Box at "Change Additional Recipients" is not selected resulting in missing operation.

Not critical, but very inconvenient.

fields.description:
We currently have a 10 user starter license. After adding 10 users to the system, the Admin panel on my dashboard has the following message beside the License heading: "You have reached the number of users allowed to use JIRA by your license.  If you require more user accounts, consider purchasing a full license."

The word "purchasing" is linked to "/plugins/servlet/gadgets/$externalLinkUtil.getProperty(%27external.link.jira.personal.site%27)", and clicking this link produces the following Tomcat error:

   HTTP Status 404 - Could not find servlet for: /plugins/servlet/gadgets/$externalLinkUtil.getProperty('external.link.jira.personal.site')
   
Our JIRA installation is very straight forward and should not have any customizations that would cause this problem.
fields.summary: Bad link in "max users in license" notice

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21518].
  {panel}

Steps:
1. open the Task Board
2. click on Log Work or Original Estimate for a task
3. enter a fractional amount (e.g., 1.5) with no unit
4. click the check mark or Log Work button
5. enter the same fractional amount with the default work unit (e.g., h)
6. click the check mark or Log Work button

Observed:
Even with a default work unit set, when you try to enter a fractional amount without a unit, you get an error message saying "Invalid duration, expected format: 2w 3d 4h 30m". If you add the default unit, you do not get the error message. 

Expected:
The default work unit should be used for fractional entries as well as whole numbers.
fields.summary: Unit is required when entering fractional work units

fields.description:
The Gadget field API Javascript documentation at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GADGETDEV/Field+Definitions#FieldDefinitions-TextInput
says that the value of *class* attribute will be given to the resulting input.
Setting this *class* attribute has no effect.
I've attached a simple gadget plugin where I've set {code}class:"dateSearcher"{code} on line 80 of specs/new.xml.
The attached screenshot shows that the input element in question has no class set.  It should have the calendar icon to the right of it.
fields.summary: the 'class' attribute for Text Inputs in Gadget field definition API doesn't work

fields.description:
I have an Apache 2.2 reverse ajp proxy sitting in front of a standalone jira installation, for internal users to hit.  This works fine.

The same reverse ajp proxy settings on an internet facing host works as well, provided we do not try to add AuthType Basic  as an additional hoop to jump through.

With AuthType Basic enabled, the internet facing apache, we get a 401 from Tomcat after entering in the user/pass at the apache level.

Any ideas?  Do I need to add the basic auth user to tomcat somehow?

[snip]

  <Proxy *>
    Order deny,allow
    Deny from all
    AuthType Basic
    AuthName "Jira is a restricted area."
    AuthUserFile /etc/httpd/conf/vhosts/jira_htpassword
    require valid-user
    satisfy any
  </Proxy>

  ProxyRequests		Off
  ProxyPreserveHost	On

  ProxyPass        	/	ajp://jirahostip:8009/
  ProxyPassReverse 	/	ajp://jirahostip:8009/

[snip]
fields.summary: Jira does not work behind Apache Proxy with Basic Auth

fields.description:
Many JIRA plugins provide a place where they can be configured in the Admin menu. Some create their own top-level section (CustomWare Salesforce, GreenHopper). Some just add a new link somewhere in the Admin menus. It would be helpful to have a single place for JIRA admins to look for plugins and for plugin developers to add their configuration links. 

My suggestion is to add new top-level menu section named "Plugins" just above the existing "System" section at the end. If there are no plugins installed, then this new section can just be empty or contain a message "no plugins". Plugins can then add their own subsections to this new section instead of scattering them all over the existing menus. Ideally, the plugins would be alphabetically ordered to make finding them easier.
fields.summary: Add a top-level section "Plugins" to the Admin menu

fields.description: When you press the Online Help symbol next to Priorities you get all Issue Types, Priority Levels, Statuses and Resolutions listed. I think it would be less confusing to only show those that are valid for the project the issue belongs to. When it comes to Security Levels, for instance, the user can only see the Security Levels he or she has access to.
fields.summary: Online help for Priority

In any version of Internet Explorer:

1) Go to the View Issue page.
2) Open either comment box.
3) Paste or type in a long comment.
4) Try to navigate through the comment using PageUp/PageDown.

Pressing PageUp will move the caret to the start of the comment box (but not the viewport). 
Pressing PageDown will move the caret to the end of the comment box.

WHERE  id = ?  (Invalid column name 'id'.)
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:UPDATE jiraschema.jiraissue SET  RESOLUTIONDATE = ?  WHERE  id = ?  (Invalid column name 'id'.)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.bulkUpdateByPrimaryKey(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:565)

{noformat}

or

Exception thrown during upgrade: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:UPDATE jiraschema.portalpage 
SET ppversion = ? WHERE id = ? (Invalid column name 'id'.) com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException:

fields.description:
A parameter has been introduced to control which permissions are necessary to display a gadget. 

The parameter is called "roles-required". The values that I know for it are:

||Values||||Description||
|use||JIRA Users Permission|
|admin|JIRA Administrators|
|browse||Browse Projects|
|sysadmin||JIRA System Administrators|
fields.summary: Document roles-required parameter for the JIRA gadgets plugin

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create JIRA db with case insensitive collation
{noformat}
CREATE DATABASE jiradb CHARACTER SET utf8 COLLATE utf8_general_ci;
{noformat}
# Add two workflows, one called 'ABC' and the second one 'abc'.
!workflow.png|thumbnail!
# Create new workflow scheme e.g 'myscheme' and assign the 'ABC' workflow to it.
!workflow_scheme.png|thumbnail!
# If you navigate to the Workflows page, you notice that both workfows have been associated with the scheme.
!scheme_association.png|thumbnail!

JIRA generates the association between the workflows and the scheme with help of following SQL queries:
{noformat}
"SELECT ID, SCHEME, WORKFLOW, issuetype FROM workflowschemeentity WHERE WORKFLOW='ABC'"
"SELECT NAME, DESCRIPTION FROM workflowscheme WHERE ID='10020'"
"SELECT ID, SCHEME, WORKFLOW, issuetype FROM workflowschemeentity WHERE WORKFLOW='abc'"
"SELECT NAME, DESCRIPTION FROM workflowscheme WHERE ID='10020'"
{noformat}
fields.summary: JIRA is not fully compatible with case insensitive collation

fields.description:
Currently, the Created vs. Resolved chart shows just that - a comparison of newly created issues vs. the number that are resolved. It would be nice if there was an option to included re-opened tickets as well.  If there are a considerable number of re-opened tickets, you eventually run into "negative" situations (see attached "Created vs. Resolved.gif" for a real example).  Note that this example goes back to the beginning of the project (so there were no issues at all on the far left of the chart).  In this case (where the entire project history is included), we really should never have more issues resolved then created.

Note that I originally created this in the charting plugin JIRA instance (JCHART-356), but realized that this chart is now officially part of JIRA.
fields.summary: Created vs. Resolved Chart: Include Re-opened Tickets

fields.description:
Running the out of box CreateOrComment handler for processing inbound e-mail messages to our JIRA instance and using the bulk=forward flag seems to correctly reject most message including out of office replies and mail server bounce messages. 

However, the combination of an Out Of Office reply in response to a Postini (our contracted anti-spam service) Quarantine Summary results in new JIRA issues being created. 

Is there any way with the default e-mail handler to filter out these messages so they don't create issues in JIRA?
fields.summary: Filter messages from an specific email address or subject so they don't create issues in JIRA

fields.description:
The problem can be easily reproduced:
# Access some issue
# Click on "More Actions" and then "Delete"
# Click on "Delete" button
# Before the action is fully performed by server, click "Delete" button again

I think it may happen in other actions too!

*Possible Solution for this:*
When clicking any action button, it should disable the button.
This way, it'll prevent any further clicks on the button to cause exceptions.
fields.summary: Exception is thrown when clicking "Delete" issue button a second time

fields.description:
Using the default installer of version 4.1.1 and selecting "install as service" during setup fails without an error: at the end of setup, the service is not started. Trying to start it using "Start Jira Service [8080]" flashes a DOS screen, but does nothing.

Executing the command {{start_service.bat}} from a command window shows the following error:

{quote}{{The service name is invalid.}}

{{More help is available by typing NET HELPMSG 2185.}}{quote}

Digging slightly deeper reveals that the service name is incorrect inside the batch file. Note that it is also incorrect in the {{stop_service.bat}} file. The contents of the {{start_service.bat}} file is as follows, the last line should be changed to match the correct name:

{noformat}@echo off
if "%OS%" == "Windows_NT" setlocal
rem ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
rem Start script for the JIRA Service
rem

net start JIRA040610093559{noformat}

As a workaround, it works to go to Services and start the service manually. Alternatively, you can update the last line of the {{start_service.bat}} (and the {{stop_service.bat}} resp.) as follows:

{noformat}net start tomcat6{noformat}

_Notes: this described behavior is consistently wrong in other versions of windows I ever used this setup with (Windows 2008, Windows Vista, Windows 2003)._
fields.summary: Setup does not start the service and manually starting service using start_service.bat fails with error

fields.description:
I am currently trying to setup JIRA and Confluence for one division of Volkswagen. I've integrated custom seraph authenticators to support the Volkswagen SSO system which seems to work quite well (at least for Confluence). But JIRA gives us real trouble here. 

In our setup the client requests come from the internet or intranet, hit some firewalls, then at least one proxy and finally is delivered to the JIRA tomcat. If I put in the attributes for proxyName, proxyPort and scheme in the tomcat connector as described in the documentation, I get several errors. JIRA is trying to load parts of the dashboard, plugins and gadgets via http. This cannot work for several reasons:

1) For security reasons the proxy URL that is used from the outside to access JIRA is not reachable from inside the firewall. And no, drilling holes into the firewall for JIRA or any other application is not an option.

2) The generated requests lack the authentication tokens that are added by the proxys, so that the custom authenticator will choke if the request is not coming from the proxy.

Why on earth is JIRA not using an internal API to request gadgets etc.? Why using HTTP as transport between two java modules that share the very same JVM?

We currently think about dirty hacks like modifying /etc/host for the JIRA server and faking some authentication headers using another apache but all these troubles just for setting up a bug tracking tool makes me think, that JIRA isn't really "enterprise ready" yet.

Or do you know any workaround for that issue that doesn't involve modifying the firewall? I think this problem is related to JRA-19375, right?
fields.summary: JIRA can't be setup easily in an enterprise environment where the proxy is in a different fw zone than the jira server

fields.description:
When I am creating an issue, I know there are people that are interested in this issue. I should be able to add them as a watcher of the issue. Since it's assigned by me, created by me... they're probably never going to be aware or involved in the issue... that's poor.

Thanks for listening to me whinge :)

fields.description:
When a subtask is deleted, the email notification does not provide any information about which issue is the parent of the subtask; nor is there any way to find it out.

The use case for us is this:
* The presence of a "QA testing" subtask on a story indicates that QA has committed to testing that story.
* If we receive a notification for the deletion of a "QA testing" subtask, we need to know which story we are no longer testing and what's happened.
* There is no way to find which story was affected.
fields.summary: Subtask deletion notifications do not specify the parent issue

fields.description:
The JIRA docs have a great guide telling people how to get their own local version of the JIRA docs:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Local+JIRA+documentation

In the section on using the XML export files from CAC (JIRA 4.0 and later), we should mention the fact that our CAC docs use the Documentation theme.
(Point them to the guide to the doc theme:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Local+JIRA+documentation)

Also mention that by default, when you import a space from XML, it will be loaded with the Documentation theme as the space theme. (Sarah has tested this on Thurs 3 June using Confluence 3.2.1.)

Also, their space will inherit our customised header, footer and left-hand navigation bar.

Due to the fact that we use these locations to link to earlier versions of the docs, and to provide the copyright notice etc, they will find that their own space has some broken links and broken include statements.

See attached screenshot -- this is what my new space looks like immediately after importing from XML.

The fix is to customise the header, footer and left-hand nav to suit their own environment, or simply to remove all content from the header, footer and left-hand nav bar and to reselect the "page tree" checkbox. See
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+Documentation+Theme

Alternatively, they can choose a different theme.
fields.summary: Guide to creating your own local docs should mention the Documentation theme and its inclusions

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. However, there is a free add-on on the Marketplace with this functionality: [Bulk Move Subtasks JIRA Add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/info.renjithv.jira.plugins.bulkmove.bulkmove-subtasks-jira-plugin].

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Currently it's not possible to perform a bulk operation on a bunch of sub-tasks to move them to a new parent. This is rather annoying when splitting subtasks off from one task to another (e.g. from a "miscellaneous" task to a specific task once a set of sub-tasks gets large).

It would be great to be able to change the parents of any sub-tasks in a group when a move operation is specified. This seems to make sense anyways and would also allow moving subtasks (along with regular tasks!) to a new project if the new parent task was in the new project.
fields.summary: Bulk move on sub-tasks should support changing the parents

I downloaded JIRA Standalone from atlassian.com/jira/try. The Mac download confirm page also allows you to download the md5 file, called atlassian-jira-enterprise-4.1.1-standalone.tar.gz.md5.gz

Double clicking on this file creates a file called atlassian-jira-enterprise-4.1.1-standalone.tar.gz.md5.gz.cpgz, generating an extension longer than the original file. Double clicking that file creates a duplicate of the original downloaded file. 

I also tried to unzip the file from the command line with both tar -zxvf and gunzip and both generated errors, see the attached screenshot for details.

Possible solutions: linking to a un-archivable file, or posting the md5 checksum online for people to read.

I would really like to have a Resolved vs. Closed Chart gadget in JIRA, very similar to the Created vs. Resolved chart.  As a tester with a large chunk of bugs that need to be verified/closed, I need to see if we are making progress, or if bugs are still being resolved faster than we can verify/close them.

Is there any easy way for me to copy the Created vs. Resolved chart and change it to Resolved vs. Closed?  Is there another gadget available that I could use for this?

I also see some value in having a Created vs. Assigned chart to see how fast developers are accepting issues.  Maybe it would be worth it to have the "Created" and "Resolved" be options to select in the gadget while editing it?
fields.summary: Resolved vs. Closed Chart gadget

fields.description:
This bug is being tracked against the Charting Plugin here [JCHART-361|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/JCHART-361]

When using the Workload Pie Chart gadget, if there's no original estimates in the selected issues JIRA will return a JSON response correctly but with a 503 error code. According to [RFC 2616|http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html]:

{quote}
*503 Service Unavailable*
The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server. The implication is that this is a temporary condition which will be alleviated after some delay. If known, the length of the delay MAY be indicated in a Retry-After header. If no Retry-After is given, the client SHOULD handle the response as it would for a 500 response.

Note: The existence of the 503 status code does not imply that a server must use it when becoming overloaded. Some servers may wish to simply refuse the connection.
{quote}

The server is not overloaded or down for maintenance, so 503 is probably not the most appropriate response code when there's simply no issues to display. This can cause issues where the JSON error message isn't displayed when a reverse proxy is being used, for example WebSEAL. WebSEAL rewrites the responses according to the error code returned, so the user gets a big scary "Service unavailable!"-type error message instead of the nice one we're returning.
fields.summary: Inappropriate response code (503) returned when no original estimates available for Workload Pie Chart gadget
MemoryPropertySet should be replaced because contains major bottleneck for highly loaded systems

fields.description:
Hello,
Today, if I configure a [Notification Scheme|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+Notification+Scheme] to notify the Reporter and the Project Lead when an issue is created, JIRA will send two e-mails: one with the Reporter as the recipient, and other with the Project Lead as the recipient.
Moreover, if I configure a Notification Scheme to notify a group, contained by individual users, JIRA will send 'N' e-mails, one to each group member.

It would be great if it were possible to configure JIRA to send a single e-mail, with 'N' users as recipients, and to show all the recipients in the To: list.

Please let me know if you need further explanation.

Thanks,
________________________
Felipe Kraemer
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Single E-mail to Multiple Users on Notification Schemes

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Copy the default Issue Type Scheme so that there is a new scheme available
# Create a new project
# View the project in the administration section of JIRA
# Where it says "Issue Type Scheme:" click *Edit*
# Make some modification to the scheme (i.e. either add or remove an issue type, or change the default type)
# Click the *Save* button

Expected:

* User is taken back to either the list of Issue Type Schemes or the Project Admin view

Actual:

User sees the "Session Expired" page with the following information:

{quote}
JIRA could not complete this action due to a missing form token.

You may have been away from your web browser for a while, which could have resulted in the expiry of your current form token. A new form token has been reissued.

JIRA administrators : Please refer to this page for details on disabling form token checking.

Problematic action : SelectIssueTypeSchemeForProject.jspa

The original input has been captured and you can retry the operation.

Sorry, but any file attachments in the original input will be lost.
{quote}

Note that editing the Issue Type Scheme *without* going through the Project Admin screen (i.e. going to *Issue Types* > *Issue Types Scheme* > *Edit*) does not result in this problem.
fields.summary: Session Expired message appears when trying to edit the Issue Type Scheme associated with a project

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21452].
  {panel}

Cloned from Conflunce. JIRA should do this for all current monospaced textareas (like description, env, comment)


Currently our CSS specifies just 'monospace', which uses the browser's default monospace font. This usually isn't the nicest-looking monospace font available on the platform.

We should add some styles which use the monospace fonts used by the OS on each platform:

- On Windows, Consolas
- On Mac OS X, Monaco.

(Any recommendations on an appropriate Linux monospace font would be great! :))

The font size needs to be specified in px (rather than the current points) because in my testing these fonts appear to vary considerably in size when the same point size is specified. Pixels don't have the same problem.
fields.summary: Better monospace font for monospaced textarea

fields.description:
I found a problem while using the JQL to filter sub-task issues with Story Points by the parent.
The problem is if my JQL is like this:
{code}
project = Marketing and issuetype = "Technical task"  order by "Story Points"
{code}
The Story Point Column will show as you can see in the JQL_1.jpg

But if my JQL is like this:
{code}
project = Marketing and issuetype = "Technical task" and parent="MKT-2" order by "Story Points"
{code}
The Story Point Column will not show as you can see in the JQL_2.jpg

The Issue Type *Technical task* have Story Point Custom Field associated with the create screen.
This issue type it's a sub-task from the parent issue type *Story*. e.g.: MKT-2 in the pictures.

I think with and without parent set in the JQL the Story Point need to show up.
The Story Point column was add in Administration >> Issue Fields >> Navigator Columns, too.
fields.summary: Custom Field column don't show up when JQL is filtered by parent.

fields.description:
If any required field is not filled in the first time during a resolved issue transition, the Charting Plugin's Resolution Date will not be captured by the index.

This is reproduceable in for JIRA 3.13.3 and JIRA 3.13.5. However, it does not occured in JIRA 4.x and above because Resolution Date is no longer available in JIRA Charting Plugin. Here are the steps to reproduce the problem:
# Install [JIRA Charting Plugin|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/288] and [JIRA Suite Utilities|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/5048]
# Create a custom field and set it as required in Resolved Issue transition
# Create Resolution Date Custom Field Type and add it to the View Issue Screen
# Create a new issue
# Resolve the issue and make sure to fill in the required field. You should be able to see the Resolution Date's value in the Issue View Screen as shown in ResolutionDate.png
# Create another new issue 
# Resolve the issue, without filling the value for the required field. JIRA will prompt error as shown in RequiredField.png and ask for value to be fill in the required field. After the required field is filled continue with resolving the issue. The Resolution Date will not appear as shown in NoResolutionDate.png.
# Search for both of the issue in Issue Filter using the Resolution Date only and JIRA will find the first issue only.

JIRA still could not find the issues even after Re-Indexing.
fields.summary: Unable to filter the Resolution Date if the field required by Field Required Validator is not filled in the first time
Add Watcher to issue using API (XmlRpc or SoapRpc)

fields.description:
The current task/sub-task UI in JIRA is not up to the quality of the other features. It looks like an after thought. A typical use case would be I create a container or summary issue like "Add French support to website" and then add sub-tasks like "Add French Home Page", "Add French Bio Page", etc.   In such a case what I would like to see when I view issues is a check box (or menu item): "collapse sub-tasks".  When checked I would see "Add French support to website" with an arrow I can click to display a detail child grid with the sub-tasks that would be slightly indented or use a different font, etc in way that it is easily discriminable from the parent tasks, that is, I would see only the parent tasks and tasks with no children unless I checked on the details button for a parent task.   The estimated time and time remaining for the parent task would automatically be the sum of those times for the child tasks.  The state of the parent task would automatically reflect the child task that is earliest in the workflow (e.g. in default workflow if any were open it would say open. Else if any were in progress or greater it would say in progress, else if any were resolved or greater it would say resolved, etc.)

When unchecked, the parent tasks would be hidden and I would just see the sub-tasks and any tasks that have no child tasks. The child tasks could contain a button to bring up the parent task info if desired.

Instead what I get is no collapsed mode and in the non-collapsed mode I see both the parent task and the child task as if they were each actionable when in reality the parent task is just a container or summary issue if you will. Additionally they are not grouped together in any way. (Why bother having the concept of a parent task if you don't see the sub-tasks grouped in some way?) This is confusing to me not to mention the less technically savvy users I have. If all the tasks are assigned to one user, I assign the parent task to them and then they want to close it because it looks like a duplicate. I end up leaving the parent task assigned to me which is only slightly less confusing and requires me to constantly check if all the subtasks are done so I can close it. Just not ready for prime time in my opinion.
fields.summary: Need True Hierachical View for Sub-Tasks

fields.summary: Absolute Unresolved Issues Chart

fields.description:
Version 2.0 JIRA service plugins cannot access field *Generator's unless the class referenced by the loaded object descriptor has been 'exploded' under <jira-home>/WEB-INF/classes/com/...

For example, the snippet below shows 2 different Generator's being referenced. The first results in a java.lang.ClassNotFoundException during server startup, the second one works fine. The first one references a custom class located only in the v2.0 plugin jar, the second one is a standard Atlassian class:

{code}
<property>
    <key>project</key>
    <name>Attempt1</name>
    <type>select</type>
    <values class="com.company.jira.services.email.utilities.ProjectValuesGenerator" />
</property>


<property>
    <key>popserver</key>
    <name>admin.service.common.handler.popserver</name>
    <type>select</type>
    <values class="com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailServersValuesGenerator"/>
</property>
{code}

Once the class com.company.jira.services.email.utilities.ProjectValuesGenerator was copied under <jira home>/WEB-INF/classes/com/company/jira/services/email/utilities/ProjectValuesGenerator the ClassNotFoundException went away.

also, as an aside, the generator com.atlassian.jira.portal.ProjectValuesGenerator doesn't work, that's why I created my own and got the bug. Has to do with the BUG comment about user being cached somewhere.
fields.summary: ValuesGenerator implementations for a Service Plugin point can not be loaded from the plugin's classloader
